title: Veolia Water Technologies to expand in Wuxi, China with new intelligent factory
summary: Veolia Water Technologies & Solutions is expanding its operations in Wuxi, China to introduce new products and build energy-saving and environmentally friendly clean production lines.  The company will transform its Wuxi site into a base of R&D and product assembly in China.  Veolia’s Wuxi facility is the largest production base of Veolia Group in Asia Pacific region.

title: How Google is supporting the circular economy
summary: Google's circularity program aims to minimize waste and maximize the reuse of finite resources. The program has three core principles: design-out waste and pollution, keep products and materials in use, and promote safe and healthy materials. Google has made progress in each of these areas, including achieving zero-waste to landfill at seven of its data centers and incorporating recycled materials into its hardware products.

title: Waste Reduction
summary: This article provides information on what materials should be disposed of in the grey landfill bin, and which materials are not accepted.  Landfill is the last option for waste, so materials should not be disposed of in the grey bin if they can be recycled elsewhere.  Materials that cannot be recycled or composted should be put in the grey bin.
